title: Bob Streit -- Trouble Brewing in Modern Agriculture Production and Possible Solutions

tasks.task: Conducting a soil and plant analysis to check for mineral deficiencies and herbicide residues.
subtasks: Taking soil samples from fields before and after crop growth.
Observing and recording color and texture changes in crops to detect mineral deficiencies or disease.
Using a mobile X-ray diffraction instrument to analyze food products for minerals and pesticides.
Timing the analysis process using a stopwatch or similar device.

tasks.task: Managing farm equipment to prepare for harvest and reduce the use of glyphosate.
subtasks: Coordinating combine harvest schedules to minimize the need for desiccant applications.
Monitoring and applying herbicides only when necessary to prevent overuse and residue accumulation.
Storing and managing grain properly to prevent contamination from molds and mycotoxins.

tasks.task: Supporting sustainable agriculture practices to improve soil health and reduce chemical dependencies.
subtasks: Implementing cover cropping and crop rotation to enhance soil structure and microbial activity.
Testing and adjusting pH levels of soil to optimize nutrient availability.
Educating fellow farmers about the benefits of traditional crop varieties and heirloom seeds.

tasks.task: Advocating for food safety and consumer health awareness.
subtasks: Participating in conferences and seminars to discuss the impacts of agricultural chemicals on public health.
Distributing informational materials and resources on healthy nutrition, organic farming, and natural remedies.
Building partnerships with organizations dedicated to environmental and public health advocacy.

tasks.task: Conducting research and testing alternative farming methods.
subtasks: Experimenting with different organic pest control methods and natural fertilizers.
Collaborating with academicians and researchers to develop new techniques for prion detection and safe food processing.
Monitoring the effects of various agricultural practices on soil, water, and air quality.

tasks.task: Providing animal care and monitoring for symptoms of toxicity or mineral deficiencies.
subtasks: Regularly checking livestock for signs of botulism, chronic fatigue, or other related conditions.
Utilizing probiotics and dietary supplements to support gut health in animals and humans.
Monitoring water sources for contamination and treating as necessary to ensure safe consumption.

tasks.task: Educating the community about the importance of clean water and healthy eating habits.
subtasks: Organizing community events and workshops to promote local food systems and sustainable living.
Collaborating with schools and healthcare providers to incorporate environmental health education into curricula.
Advocating for stricter regulations on agricultural chemicals and their residues in food products.

tasks.task: Training staff and family members on proper food handling and allergy awareness.
subtasks: Developing emergency protocols for managing allergic reactions and other health crises.
Implementing strict sanitation protocols in the kitchen and throughout the farm operation.
Providing first aid training for employees and family members to handle common health issues on the farm.
